Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of the Republican health care bill by stating that seniors can be charged five times what anybody else is charged for health care for pre-existing conditions, without mentioning that the Affordable Care Act already allows insurance companies to charge older people three times as much.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide specific evidence or data to back up the assertion that seniors can be charged five times more for health care under the Republican health care bill.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that the Republican health care bill would have directly resulted in seniors being charged five times more for health care for pre-existing conditions, without considering other factors or alternative explanations.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the claim, such as the possibility that the increase in charges for seniors under the Republican health care bill was not as drastic as implied, or that there were other provisions in the bill that could have mitigated the impact on seniors.
